business.headline: Bitcoin zooms past $120,000 to reach all-time high. Here's whyThe world's largest cryptocurrency was last seen trading at $120,700.54, up 1.32%, as investor confidence remained strong ahead of important regulatory discussions in the United States.
Sensex, Nifty start week in red as IT stocks drag markets lower againThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 266.34 points to 82,234.13, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 67.95 points to 25,081.90 as of 9:22 am.

Travel Food Services to make market debut today; here's the latest GMPTravel Food Services listing: The grey market premium (GMP), which had dropped sharply in the past week, has seen a slight rise ahead of the listing.

Jane Street deposits Rs 4,843.5 crore, set to return to Dalal Street: ReportIn its interim order, Sebi had accused Jane Street of using manipulative strategies in Indian stock markets. The regulator directed the firm to deposit alleged unlawful gains in an escrow account with a scheduled commercial bank in India.

Why claiming your PF money seems so difficultIt all starts with tiny mistakes. A spelling error in your name, a mismatch in your date of birth, or an old bank account number can be enough to freeze your claim.

Will India be hit with a 500% tariff? Here's what we knowIndia remains one of the few countries still in talks with the US at a time when the Trump administration is preparing to enforce steep new tariffs on imports from several nations starting August 1.

Tesla drops 'coming soon' teaser on new X account ahead of India launchTesla is set to open its first Indian showroom in Mumbai's Bandra Kurla Complex on July 15. The Tesla India X account shared a "coming soon" post on Friday night.

Elon Musk's Tesla likely to begin first deliveries in India from August: ReportThis move comes at a key moment for Tesla. The carmaker has seen sales dip in other countries and is now turning to India, the world's third-largest car market, to reach new buyers.

Zerodha's Nithin Kamath hits back at 'dark patterns' used by financial appsNithin Kamath says these tricks are designed to push people into taking actions that are not in their best interest, just so companies can make more money.
Sensex ends 690 points lower, Nifty settles below 25,200; TCS falls 4%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 689.81 points to end at 82,500.47, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 205.40 points to close at 25,149.85.

New banks coming soon? India eyes first permits since 2014, says reportThe government and central bank are said to be considering multiple steps to create more, larger and stronger banks that can support India's ambitious economic growth plans over the coming decades.

Got Rs 5 lakh health insurance? Should you buy a top-up or higher sum insuredWhen you file a claim, your base policy settles the expenses first. If the bill crosses that limit, the top-up steps in. Normally, your base plan pays up to its maximum, and then the top-up kicks in to handle the rest.
Sensex plunges 700 points: Why the stock market fell 1% today? The S&P BSE Sensex fell nearly 700 points to 82,509.59, while the NSE Nifty50 declined by nearly 200 points to 25,162.25 as of 12:21 pm.

ITR-2 and ITR-3 excel utilities released: Who can file and what's new?ITR-2 is meant for individuals or Hindu Undivided Families (HUFs) who are not eligible to file ITR-1 (Sahaj). This form is meant for taxpayers who do not have any income from business or profession and do not earn any income like interest, salary, bonus, commission, etc.

Bitcoin breaks $117,000 mark, reaches all-time highAt the time of writing at 11.00 am, the world's largest cryptocurrency is trading at $117,863.18, climbing by 6.13% over the last 24 hours. Crypto experts believe if the supportive policies continue, digital coins could see even more new money coming in.

Tesla drives into India: Mumbai to get first experience centre on July 15The space will allow visitors to explore Tesla's electric cars and related technologies, though test drives and deliveries may not be offered at this stage.

TCS falls 2% on Q1 results miss. Should you buy as IT stocks struggle?TCS share price: The IT giant has lost 2.74% over the past five days and declined 4.37% in the past month. Over a six-month period, the stock is down 22.63%.

Explained: Why HUL shares rose 4% todayHUL shares were up 3.8%, trading at Rs 2,500 as of 9;25 am, compared to Thursday's closing price of Rs 2,409.05. The stock ended Thursday's session nearly 1% lower but has gained 3.58% in the past five days.
Sensex opens 280 points lower, Nifty below 25,300; HUL up 4%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 250.37 points to 82,939.91, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 64.95 points to 25,290.30 as of 9:32 am.

Stock market opening: Weak TCS Q1 results to hamper Sensex, Nifty?The Gift Nifty futures were trading at 25,295 as of 8:30 am, suggesting that the Nifty 50 could open below Thursday's closing mark of 25,355.25.
Who is Priya Nair, first woman CEO of Hindustan UnileverPriya Nair will take over from Rohit Jawa, who will step down on July 31, 2025. Nair's appointment will come into effect from August 1, 2025.

IMF praises UPI, says it makes India global leader in fast paymentUnified Payments Interface is an instant and real-time payment system developed by NPCI to facilitate inter-bank transactions through mobile phones.
Sensex closes 346 points lower, Nifty below 25,400; Airtel down 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 345.80 points to end at 83,190.28, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 120.85 points to close at 25,355.25.

Dubai dreams under scanner as ED questions homebuyers: ReportMany of the individuals who bought property in Dubai are now under scrutiny as they failed to provide proper bank transaction records showing how the payments were made.

8th Pay Commission may hike salaries by 30–34%: ReportThe 8th Pay Commission could benefit around 11 million people, including about 4.4 million central government employees and nearly 6.8 million pensioners. Once approved, the changes will raise their basic pay, allowances, and retirement benefits.

Will ITR filing deadline be extended again? Here's why it mightIn May, the CBDT announced extending the ITR filing deadline, citing big changes in the forms and system readiness. It said that the updated ITRs will make compliance simpler and reporting more transparent for taxpayers.

Zepto, Blinkit, Instamart face a new rival in Delhi's 10-min delivery warThe move brings the e-commerce giant into direct competition with local players such as Blinkit (owned by Eternal), Swiggy Instamart and Zepto, who already dominate the quick delivery space.

Smartworks Coworking Spaces IPO open for bidding: Should you subscribe?The bidding window for the IPO will remain open until Monday, July 14. Investors can place bids within the price band of Rs 387 to Rs 407 per share.

When nursery fees need an EMI: CoinSwitch co-founder flags new middle-class crisisOnce believed to be the key to a better life, schooling today has ironically become the heaviest expense for India's middle-class families, who are struggling to keep up, says Ashish Singhal, co-founder of CoinSwitch.

Nvidia now worth nearly as much as India's economy. Details hereAccording to the International Monetary Fund (IMF), India's gross domestic product is currently estimated at $4.2 trillion and is expected to touch $4.27 trillion by the end of 2025.

3 key reasons behind Bitcoin's record high todayAt the time of writing, Bitcoin is trading at $111,019.74, rising by 2.27% over the past day. The last record was set on May 22 when it briefly touched $111,970. Since then, Bitcoin has had a bumpy ride, but it seems to be back with a bang.

TCS to announce Q1 results today: Here's what to expect from the IT giantTCS Q1 results: Apart from growth numbers, the market will also watch for any announcements on interim dividends, updates on client budgets in sectors like banking, retail, and manufacturing, and comments on the pace of new deal wins.
Sensex opens 85 points higher, Nifty above 25,400; Tata Steel up 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 43.60 points to 83,492.48, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 15.90 points to 25,460.20 as of 9:28 am.

Bitcoin rockets to a record high, just shy of $112,000. Here's whyAs Bitcoin's market cap has crossed into the trillions, more institutional investors are entering the space. Large firms that once stayed away are now taking positions in digital assets, helping push prices higher.

Travel Food Services allotment: Step-by-step to check allotment statusInvestors can check their allotment status either through the BSE website or the registrar's platform, MUFG Intime India Private Limited (Link Intime India Pvt Ltd).

Nvidia makes history, becomes first company to hit $4 trillion in market valueNvidia's market cap now exceeds the combined value of the Canadian and Mexican stock markets. It is also larger than the total market capitalisation of all publicly listed companies in the UK, according to LSEG data.

Emirates signs deal to accept crypto payments for flight bookings: ReportIn recent years, the UAE has grown into a popular place for crypto companies. Many crypto firms have opened offices there or are planning to expand. Today, people in the UAE can already use cryptocurrencies to pay for things like real estate, school fees and even transport services.
Sensex closes 176 points lower, Nifty below 25,500; HCLTech down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 176.43 points to 83,536.08, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 46.40 points to 25,476.10 as of 3:47 pm.

Reliance Jio IPO hits pause button, 2025 listing unlikely: ReportReliance Industries shares fell sharply after the news and were down 1.8% in afternoon trade, dragging the broader market into negative territory.

Sebi's ban on Jane Street: Could it rattle Dalal Street?While the ban is focused on a single player, many believe it may have wider effects on liquidity, trading volumes, investor confidence, and even foreign investor behaviour.

entertainment.headline: Superman box office day 3: James Gunn's film flies high, crushes 1st weekend numbers'Superman' rocked a fabulous first weekend at the Indian box office. The James Gunn-directorial has impressed the Indian audience, and is looking at recording a good first week.

Urvashi Rautela carries labubus to Wimbledon, internet can't stop laughingUrvashi Rautela's photos from Wimbledon 2025 went viral after she carried four Labubu dolls to the match while wearing a white gown. Fans on social media shared funny comments and memes about her unique look.

Metro In Dino box office Day 10: Anurag Basu's monsoon romantic drama wins all overMetro... In Dino remained steady during weekdays, and performed decently well during its second weekend at the box office. The film has also surpassed the new Bollywood releases.

SS Rajamouli pushes fan trying for selfie at Kota Srinivasa Rao's funeral. VideoA video of SS Rajamouli pushing away a fan trying to click a selfie during veteran actor Kota Srinivasa Rao's funeral in Hyderabad has gone viral. The farewell was also attended by several Tollywood actors.

Actor Silambarasan sheds 10 kg in 10 days for Vetri Maaran's upcoming filmSilambarasan TR, known as STR, has undergone significant weight loss for his role in Vetri Maaran's new film. He reportedly lost around 10 kilograms in 10 days to play a youthful version in the film.

R Madhavan addresses Hindi-Marathi debate, says never faced any problemActor R Madhavan shared his views on the Hindi-Marathi language row. He shared his personal experience and said he never faced any problems because of language.

Stuntman dies during shoot of Pa Ranjith-Arya film, actor Vishal pays tributeStuntman Raju died while performing a car stunt on the sets of an upcoming Kollywood film. The film features actor Arya and is being directed by Pa Ranjith. Actor Vishal paid tribute to Raju on X.

Aamir met Riteish, asked if I was working: Genelia on how she was cast in SitaareActor Genelia Deshmukh discussed how she was cast for 'Sitaare Zameen Par'. She said it was actor Aamir Khan who met her husband Riteish Deshmukh and enquired whether she was working.

Singer Amaal Mallik accuses Anu Malik of ruining father Daboo Malik's careerAmaal Mallik has accused his uncle Anu Malik of professional sabotage that led to his father Daboo Malik's depression, revealing deep family and industry tensions. Despite the rivalry, Amaal seeks to establish his own identity in music while distancing himself from Anu's controversial past.

Diljit Dosanjh stuns in intense Punjab 95 poster as Jaswant Singh KhalraDiljit Dosanjh's latest poster for 'Punjab 95' powerfully captures the intense narrative of slain human rights activist Jaswant Singh Khalra. He shared the poster on social media on Sunday.

Shilpa Shetty hesitant to work in Malayalam films, says won't be able to do justiceActor Shilpa Shetty shared that she has been offered a few movies in Malayalam but never felt sure if she could do justice to her role. She also shared her admiration for actor Mohanlal.

Munawar Faruqui's son hospitalised, wife Mehzabeen shares update in touching postComedian Munawar Faruqui is facing a personal challenge as his son Mikael battles a viral infection. His partner, Mehzabeen Coatwala, shared the update on social media.

Aayush Sharma reflects on back surgeries, says ignored body's signsActor Aayush Sharma recently reflected on his back surgeries. In an interview, he noted that a six-pack body doesn't necessarily mean a fit body. He also stated that his time at the hospital helped him bond with his family.

Superman box office Day 2: James Gunn film soars past F1, Jurassic World in IndiaJames Gunn's 'Superman' starring David Corenswet has made a strong debut at the Indian box office, earning Rs 9.25 crore on its second day and leading over recent Hollywood and Bollywood releases.

Jackie Shroff joins Kartik Aaryan's Tu Meri Main Tera, fans say OG with Gen Z heroActors Kartik Aaryan and Jackie Shroff are all set to team up for the upcoming film 'Tu Meri Main Tera Main Tera Tu Meri'. The announcement video sparked excitement amongst fans on social media. In the film, Aaryan is paired opposite actor Ananya Panday.

Kota Srinivasa Rao dies: Chiranjeevi, Pawan Kalyan attend funeral, pay tributeProminent Tollywood stars gathered to pay their respects to late Telugu icon Kota Srinivasa Rao on Sunday. He died at 83, leaving behind a rich legacy in Indian cinema with over 750 films across multiple languages.

Amaal Mallik on distancing from family: Mother would compare my journey with ArmaanSinger Amaal Mallik shared that he cut ties with his parents due to constant comparisons with his brother, Armaan Malik. However, he clarified that he shares no issues with the latter and continues to have a strong bond with him.

Actor Vanessa Hudgens announces second pregnancy with husband Cole TuckerVanessa Hudgens and her husband Cole Tucker are thrilled to announce they are expecting their second child, sharing the joyful news on Instagram. The couple, who welcomed their first child last year, are eagerly preparing to embrace the next chapter of parenthood together.

Maalik vs Aankhon box office Day 2: Rajkummar's film shows growth, Vikrant's lagsRajkummar Rao's gangster drama 'Maalik' is making a strong mark at the box office with rising collections and positive word of mouth. In contrast, the romantic drama 'Aankhon Ki Gustaakhiyan' has seen a modest start, struggling to connect with audiences.

general news.headline: S Jaishankar attends SCO meet in China, calls for open dialogue to sustain tiesAt the SCO meet in Beijing, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar met Chinese Vice President Han Zheng, stressing open dialogue and voicing hope that recent gains in India-China ties will continue.

Air India replaced crashed plane's fuel switch module twice; Boeing says it's safeAir India replaced the critical throttle control module, which includes the fuel control switches, twice on the Boeing 787 before it crashed. The investigation continues into what caused the fuel cutoff switches to activate during takeoff.

Is China's rare-earth weaponisation giving India a rare chance?China, the biggest holder of rare earths, is weaponising them by restricting the supply. Though it has hit the EV industry in India, will the country, which possesses the third-biggest reserve of rare earths, be able to use this as a rare opportunity?

Nude deepfakes shared by Trinamool cadres: Suspended student leader's big chargeTrinamool Congress student leader Rajanya Haldar, who was suspended from the party last year, has approached Kolkata Police over AI-generated deepfake semi-nude images of her being circulated among party members.
Schrodinger's Aadhaar in Bihar, it is everything and nothing at the same timeThe Election Commission exercise on voter rolls in Bihar again brings up the old question: What is Aadhaar?

Trump to give Ukraine Patriot missiles, says Putin 'talks nice, then bombs'Trump fumed at Putin for saying he wanted peace and then stepping up his attacks on Ukraine. Amid growing disenchantment with the Russian leader, the US President said he would send Patriot air defence missiles to Kyiv.

Saina Nehwal announces separation from Parupalli Kashyap after 7 years of marriageBadminton stars Saina Nehwal and Parupalli Kashyap have decided to separate after nearly 7 years of marriage. Saina announced her decision in an Instagram post on Sunday, July 13.

Wimbledon: Jannik Sinner wins maiden title, denies Carlos Alcaraz three-peatWimbledon 2025: World No.1 Jannik Sinner won his maiden title at the All England Club after beating Carlos Alcaraz in four sets on Centre Court. Alcaraz was looking to become the fifth man to win the title three times on the trot, but Sinner denied him the three-peat and conquered grass.

You complete me: Sinner and Alcaraz are crafting tennis's next great rivalryJannik Sinner returned from heartbreak in Paris to conquer Wimbledon, a comeback Carlos Alcaraz saw coming. Their rivalry, steeped in respect and driven by the relentless urge to outdo and learn from each other, is becoming tennis's most compelling new saga.

Plane crashes moments after takeoff at London airport, turns into fireballThe crash led to the cancellation of at least four scheduled flights on Sunday afternoon, according to the airport's website. Authorities have not yet disclosed how many people were on board the aircraft or their condition.

Shux to undock from Space Station today after 18-day trailblazing missionDuring their 18-day stay, Shukla and the Ax-4 crew completed over 60 advanced scientific experiments spanning biology, artificial intelligence, materials science, and human health.

Bitcoin zooms past $120,000 to reach all-time high. Here's whyThe world's largest cryptocurrency was last seen trading at $120,700.54, up 1.32%, as investor confidence remained strong ahead of important regulatory discussions in the United States.

Slow burn to fireworks: 14-wicket Day 4 sets up cracking Lord's Test finaleLord's Test: After three days of slowburn, the third Test exploded on Day 4. India bowled England out for 192 before England fought back with four wickets late on Sunday. The fifth and final day promises to be a cracker.

Mukhtar Ansari gang hitman killed in UP Police encounter; guns, cartridges seizedReleased on bail six months ago, Shahrukh Pathan had resumed threatening and attacking witnesses in old murder cases before he was tracked down and killed in a police encounter.

Paul Reiffel is the new Steve Bucknor: Fans slam umpiring at Lord'sUmpire Paul Reiffel faced heavy criticism for poor decisions against India at Lord's Test. The controversial calls sparked frustration amongst players and fans.

Swiggy delivery agent assaulted in Bengaluru road rage incidentA Swiggy delivery executive was assaulted by three unidentified men at a busy Bengaluru traffic signal, allegedly for not moving while at a red light.

India looks ambitious, fearless from space, says Shux ahead of homecomingIn a heartfelt ceremony, Shubhanshu Shukla reflected on his journey, the achievements of the mission, and the collaborative spirit that defined his time in orbit.

Delhi University student's body found in Yamuna, 6 days after disappearanceSneha was a student of Atma Ram Sanatan Dharma College, Delhi University, and had been living in Delhi away from her family for some time.
Why Mohan Yadav, Shivraj Chouhan have crossed swordsThe Madhya Pradesh chief minister's pro-conservation policies run smack into a pro-people protest from his predecessor

Pilots' union seeks role in Air India crash probe, may take legal routeALPA-India is considering legal action to be included in the Air India Boeing 787 crash investigation. The pilots' group alleged bias in the AAIB preliminary report and demanded transparency and expert involvement.

Can India chase 193 at Lord's? Here's what history suggestsEngland vs India: India bowled England out for 192 on Day 4 of the third Test at Lord's. Washington Sundar's impressive four-wicket haul was key in restricting England on a challenging pitch.

Stuntman dies during shoot of Pa Ranjith-Arya film, actor Vishal pays tributeStuntman Raju died while performing a car stunt on the sets of an upcoming Kollywood film. The film features actor Arya and is being directed by Pa Ranjith. Actor Vishal paid tribute to Raju on X.

Mohammed Siraj upset, Sunil Gavaskar blasts DRS after Joe Root survives LBW appealEngland vs India: Sunil Gavaskar criticised the ball-tracking technology after Joe Root was saved by an umpire's call at Lord's. Mohammed Siraj was left frustrated after a couple of close calls went against him on Sunday.

2 years after clashes, Haryana's Nuh shuts internet, schools for religious rallyAccording to the State Home Department's order, all social media platforms like WhatsApp, Facebook, Twitter, etc. on mobile phones and SMS services will be blocked in a bid to curb the spread of misinformation and rumours.

Superman box office day 3: James Gunn's film flies high, crushes 1st weekend numbers'Superman' rocked a fabulous first weekend at the Indian box office. The James Gunn-directorial has impressed the Indian audience, and is looking at recording a good first week.

Urvashi Rautela carries labubus to Wimbledon, internet can't stop laughingUrvashi Rautela's photos from Wimbledon 2025 went viral after she carried four Labubu dolls to the match while wearing a white gown. Fans on social media shared funny comments and memes about her unique look.

Metro In Dino box office Day 10: Anurag Basu's monsoon romantic drama wins all overMetro... In Dino remained steady during weekdays, and performed decently well during its second weekend at the box office. The film has also surpassed the new Bollywood releases.

SS Rajamouli pushes fan trying for selfie at Kota Srinivasa Rao's funeral. VideoA video of SS Rajamouli pushing away a fan trying to click a selfie during veteran actor Kota Srinivasa Rao's funeral in Hyderabad has gone viral. The farewell was also attended by several Tollywood actors.

sports.headline: Luis Enrique rues scuffle at CWC final: Situation could've been avoidedLuis Enrique admitted that the on-field scuffle between PSG and Chelsea could have been avoided. The incident took place at the FIFA Club World Cup final, where Chelsea came out victorious with a crushing 3-1 win.

Jannik Sinner breaks the Carlos Alcaraz barrier with lessons from the pastWimbledon 2025: World No.1 Jannik Sinner made a stupendous recovery from his French Open loss to Carlos Alcaraz and beat the Spaniard on Sunday at the All England Club.

India have solid batters in dressing room: Sundar confident of special Lord's winEngland vs India, 3rd Test: A confident Washington Sundar said the presence of "solid" batters in the dressing room would help India chase down the 193-run target on Day 5 of the Lord's Test against England.

Alcaraz draws motivation from intense rivalry with Sinner despite Wimbledon lossCarlos Alcaraz views his fierce rivalry with Jannik Sinner as a powerful source of motivation, despite the pain of losing his Wimbledon crown to the Italian.

Duckett's sledge unsettles Gill as India falters in Lord's TestEngland opener Ben Duckett took a sly dig at India captain Shubman Gill on Day 4 of the third Test at Lord's as tensions ran high between the two sides.

West Indies batting collapse puts Australia in control on 15-wicket dayShamar Joseph and Alzarri Joseph bowled with pace and vintage West Indies intent during the night session on Sunday, as Australia struggled to 99 for six in their second innings — a lead of 181 in the third Test.

Watch: Wimbledon champion Sinner brings gifts for Prince George, Princess CharlotteWimbledon champion Jannik Sinner was spotted handing signed tennis balls to Prince George and Princess Charlotte following his historic win over Carlos Alcaraz in the final on Sunday.

You complete me: Sinner and Alcaraz are crafting tennis's next great rivalryJannik Sinner returned from heartbreak in Paris to conquer Wimbledon, a comeback Carlos Alcaraz saw coming. Their rivalry, steeped in respect and driven by the relentless urge to outdo and learn from each other, is becoming tennis's most compelling new saga.

In Gambhir we trust: Washington Sundar relishing season of success in Test cricketEngland vs India: Washington Sundar impressed with a four-wicket haul on Day 4 of the third Test at Lord's. The all-rounder credited Gautam Gambhir's support for his success since returning to the Test fold last year.

Get 6 wickets in 1st hour: England coach warns India ahead of Day 5England's assistant coach Marcus Trescothick is confident of his bowlers getting the job done on Day 5 of the third Test against India at Lord's after England took four early wickets before stumps on Day 4.

Ice-cold Palmer destroys PSG as Chelsea win inaugural Club World CupChelsea hammered 3 goals past Champions League winners PSG to win the inaugural FIFA Club World Cup. Cole Palmer scored a brace and provided an assist as the Premier League club ripped apart PSG.

Watch: Wimbledon champion Sinner brings gifts for Prince George, Princess CharlotteWimbledon champion Jannik Sinner was spotted handing signed tennis balls to Prince George and Princess Charlotte following his historic win over Carlos Alcaraz in the final on Sunday.

You complete me: Sinner and Alcaraz are crafting tennis's next great rivalryJannik Sinner returned from heartbreak in Paris to conquer Wimbledon, a comeback Carlos Alcaraz saw coming. Their rivalry, steeped in respect and driven by the relentless urge to outdo and learn from each other, is becoming tennis's most compelling new saga.

In Gambhir we trust: Washington Sundar relishing season of success in Test cricketEngland vs India: Washington Sundar impressed with a four-wicket haul on Day 4 of the third Test at Lord's. The all-rounder credited Gautam Gambhir's support for his success since returning to the Test fold last year.

Get 6 wickets in 1st hour: England coach warns India ahead of Day 5England's assistant coach Marcus Trescothick is confident of his bowlers getting the job done on Day 5 of the third Test against India at Lord's after England took four early wickets before stumps on Day 4.

Ice-cold Palmer destroys PSG as Chelsea win inaugural Club World CupChelsea hammered 3 goals past Champions League winners PSG to win the inaugural FIFA Club World Cup. Cole Palmer scored a brace and provided an assist as the Premier League club ripped apart PSG.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
